title: Digital Customer Service Business Glia Lands $78 Million of New Funding
sub_head: The latest investment round brings total outside backing to $107 million and lets Glia keep expanding after a busy year of growth
body:
Digital customer service provider Glia Technologies Inc. has raised fresh capital of $78 million in an investment led by existing backer Insight Partners.
The Series C capital brings Glia’s total funding so far to $107 million. The new investment comes at a time where Glia is experiencing explosive growth as the financial services businesses it serves have increasingly been forced to connect with customers digitally because of the coronavirus pandemic.
Last year Glia’s annual recurring revenue rose by more than 150%, according to Chief Executive Dan Michaeli. Net customer retention exceeded 125% while 35% of revenue growth stemmed from expansion bookings, he added.
The pandemic buoyed the company’s growth, as it kept many consumers at home who, for instance, would usually go into a bank branch in person to apply for a mortgage.
Glia’s products let customers connect with banks and insurers through multiple channels, including chat, audio, video, text, phone or through social media as alternatives to trying to call a customer service representative.
